titleStmt.title: William A. Moore to James W. Tate
CWG2705

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
Midway Ky Feb 26th /62
Mr James. W. Tate,
Dear Sir

Mr Saml Clinton one of the Justices of the Peace for this District is about to remove to Missouri on or about the 1st proximo -- Please say to his Excellency Gov Magoffin that Mr Nathan. J. Roberts will accept the office if tendered to him & that the appointment would give satisfaction to a Majority of the voters of this District. I hope you will lay this before the Governor & have Mr Roberts appointed when
Mr Clinton resigns, or leaves the state. I will inform you when he starts for Missouri

very Respectfully
Your Friend
Wm A Moore
